courseDescription: This is an introductory class to Modern Standard Arabic and Middle Eastern Culture. Students are expected to reach intermediate low to intermediate mid-level. The Arabic alphabet and sounds are introduced as well as simple language in context reflecting the authentic cultural nuances dealing with simple topics ranging from family, school and hobbies. No prior knowledge is required.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Application of language rules in context

courseDescription: The class is a continuous sequence of ARAB 111F or an equivalent class. The students are expected to reach intermediate high level. The class focuses on expanding the topics of communication the students developed in the introductory class. Modern standard and Levantine Arabic will be the means of communication in class and the student will be exposed to practical grammar, authentic media and texts.  The students will produce culture through role plays and group work simulations and recognize the different registers in the targeted culture through paying attention to sociolinguistic variations.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Role plays and group work simulations
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting different registers in Arabic language

courseDescription: A topics course in Arabic, with topics announced prior to the semester in which they are offered.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Effective time management for topic research

courseTitle: Advanced Arabic Language and Culture I
courseDescription: The purpose of the class is to reinforce the vocabulary and grammar introduced in ARAB 111F and ARAB 212 through activating the learned materials and pushing the students to the advanced level. The language of interaction will be Levantine and Standard Arabic, which students will be able to manipulate to the specific language situations as in the countries this deglosic phenomenon exists.  In addition to the grammar and vocabulary introduced in the textbook, the class will incorporate an extensive authentic reading component and a variety of Arabic contemporary media to reflect the linguistic and cultural aspects of the Middle East.
Technical and Digital Skills: Manipulating Levantine and Standard Arabic language
Utilizing grammar and vocabulary in specific language situations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Interacting in Levantine and Standard Arabic
Adapting language skills to cultural contexts
Engaging in discussions on Middle Eastern linguistic and cultural aspects
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating cultural nuances in language usage
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing cultural events related to Middle Eastern languages
Facilitating group discussions on linguistic and cultural topics

courseTitle: Advanced Arabic Language and Culture II
courseDescription: The class is a continuous sequence of ARAB 311 or an equivalent class. Students are expected to reach advanced low level and explore the Middle Eastern cultures through the language spoken there. Levantine and Standard Arabic are the only means of communication in this class. The class incorporates a high load of writing to express students' ideas relating to a wide variety of Middle Eastern topics and current events, which will be introduced through weekly readings and authentic media. This is a crucial class for students planning to travel to the Middle East, who want to explore the Arab world first hand.
Technical and Digital Skills: Advanced proficiency in Levantine and Standard Arabic
High proficiency in writing in Arabic
Engaging with authentic media in Arabic
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Expressing ideas on Middle Eastern topics
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing current events in the Middle East
Critical evaluation of Middle Eastern cultures
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning for travel to the Middle East
Exploring the Arab world first hand
